intro: Indoryza coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, reducing water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a circular pattern, giving it a daisy-like appearance.
